data.description: Loyalty program's associated data (level and priority for instance)

reference.description: Loyalty program's reference (company and number for instance)

number.description: Loyalty program number (i.e. frequent traveler number)

company.description: Company name to be used for business address only

address.description: Here for backward compatibility during address -> emailAddress.address migration

countryPrefix.description: Here for backward compatibility during countryPrefix -> phoneNumber.areaCode migration

number.description: TODO Here for backward compatibility during number -> phoneNumber.localNumber migration

countryCode.description: Code of the country associated with the document (usually that has issued it)

typeCode.description: Code of the document type (eg: P: Passport, IP: Passport Care, F: Approuved Non-Standard, A, I, and C: Identity Card)

birthDate.description: Here for backward compatibility during birthDate -> data.birthDate migration

genderCode.description: Here for backward compatibility during genderCode -> data.genderCode migration

name.description: Here for backward compatibility during name -> data.name migration

nationality.description: Here for backward compatibility during nationality -> data.nationality migration

genderCode.description: Document owner's gender code associated with this identification

name.description: Document owner's full name associated with this identification

nationality.description: Document owner's nationality associated with this identification (usually the issuer of that document)

companyCode.description: Regular company code as used in PSS systems. In airline context, this is typically the carrier code in 2 or 3 characters format

suffix.description: Designator suffix. In airline context, used to distinguish a postponed flight from the one already scheduled the same day

code.description: IATA station code (e.g.: CDG for Charles de Gaulle airport)

jetlag.description: Station time difference relative to GMT (format=[hh][mm][ss][sss])

localDate.description: Local date associated to the service to be delivered (format=[yyyy][MM][dd])

localTime.description: Local time associated to the service to be delivered (format=[hh][mm][ss][sss])

businessProbability.description: Probability (in percent) that the travel is business

empty.description: True if the travel is identified as not having any relevant information

extraRequests.description: Extra requests (ssr) and their potential associated pricing (tarification) and/or receipt (ticket/document). Extra requests are transport based, which means they are always linked to a transport. eg. Unaccompagnied Minor

id.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

mealRequests.description: Meal requests (inboard meal SSR) and their potential associated pricing (tarification) and/or receipt (ticket/document). Meal requests are transport based, which means they are always linked to a transport. eg: Vegetarian Meal

otherPurchases.description: Other requests (standalone ssr/svc) and their potential associated pricing (tarification) and/or receipt (ticket/document). Other requests are NOT transport based, which means they are NOT linked to a transport. eg: Lounge Access

reference.description: PSS external reference, ie combination of PNR and passenger tattoo

removed.description: True if should be considered as removed, ie the traveler is not present in the PNR anymore, eg: removed by an agent after a pnr split

seatRequests.description: Seat requests and their potential associated pricing (tarification) and/or receipt (ticket/document). Seat requests are transport based, which means they are always linked to a transport. eg. extra leg room seat

transports.description: All the transports (segments) booked or requested by the traveler with their details (departure date & time, origin, destination, terminal, etc...) and status (eg. cancelled, confirmed, etc...)

traveler.description: Data regarding the passenger involved in the travel

tripPurchases.description: Transport acts of purchase, pricing (tarification) and/or receipt (ticket/document) associated to the purchase of one or more transports.

uuid.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

xbagRequests.description: XBAG requests (extra baggage ssr) and their potential associated pricing (tarification) and/or receipt (ticket/document). Xbag requests are transport based, which means they are always linked to a transport. eg. Sport Equipment or 1 additional piece of luggage

officeId.description: The PSS internal office ID which performed the record (typically PNR) split

passengerTattoo.description: PSS internal reference of the passenger within the PNR

splitData.description: Data regarding the potential PNR split

external.description: True if this purchase is not coming from the company main GDS. Typically identifying a document received through a SSR TKNx in airline context

id.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

items.description: Requests concerned by the purchase act. (All non-chargeable requests will be grouped in a purchase without any pricing/receipt associated to it)

payments.description: Details of payments information of the purchase

pricing.description: Materialization of all data related to the pricing of the purchase. In airline context, it is typically related to the tarification element of the PNR

receipt.description: Materialization of all data concerning purchase finalisation (i.e. ticket). In airline context, it is typically related to the document/ticket element of the PNR

restriction.description: Details of restrictions applying on the purchase

serviceFamily.description: Family of the service, in airline context: Reason For Issuance Code (RFIC); possible values: A (Air Transportation), B (Surface Transportation/Non-air Services), C (Baggage), D (Financial Impact), E (Airport Services), F (Merchandise), G (In-flight Services)

synchronization.description: Type of synchronization of the purchase regarding its items. Values are FULL (all purchased items are present), PARTIAL (some items have been removed) & NONE (all items are removed - typically a FH PNR element for air segment).

uuid.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

chargeable.description: True if the requested service is considered chargeable

code.description: Requested service item code. In airline context, values can be anything from IATA standard codes (RQST, VGML, XBAG, ...) to airline specific ones

companyCode.description: Code of the company (airline) to which the request has been sent

coupon.description: Coupon usage associated with the requested service

id.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

removed.description: True if should be considered as removed, ie not present anymore in PNR for instance

revisions.description: Revisions where item was present (only used for revalidation)

uuid.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

typeCode.description: Remark type code. In airline context,  values are (non exhaustive list) RC: corporate remark, RI: invoice remark, RM: general remark, RQ: quality control remark, RX: confidential remark, SK: special Keyword, OS: other special information

nature.description: Free text from the compensation field of the PFS giving the compensation details

voluntary.description: Indicates wether the compensation was voluntary or involontary

amount.description: Here for backward compatibility -> Original currency price amount

currencyCode.description: Here for backward compatibility -> Original currency price currency code

baseCalculated.description: Base calculated price of this fare (before taxes, fees, commisions, etc...)

baseCalculation.description: Calculation mode of the fare. In airline context, it contains the base fare calculation as described in the tarification

basePayed.description: Base payed price of this fare (used if payment is done in another currency than the one used for calculation)

grandTotal.description: Full price of this fare (including all fees)

net.description: Net price of this fare (including commissions)

total.description: Total price of this fare (including all taxes)

vatIncluded.description: Vat is included in fee rate if true. It is not otherwise.

form.description: Form of the payment (CC, CASH, ...), this is a free text

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

automatic.description: True if the pricing was automatically performed (in airline context Manual VS Automatic tarification)

exchangeRate1.description: First exchange rate used for this pricing

exchangeRate2.description: Second exchange rate used for this pricing

issuingStatusCode.description: Pricing issuing status code. In airline context values are: F First issue, I First issue IT, U First issue BT, R Re-issue, Y Re-issue IT, W Re-issue BT

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

removed.description: True if should be considered as removed, ie not present anymore in PNR for instance

validityEnd.description: Pricing validity end timestamp (purchase must be 'payed' before this deadline if specified) (format=[yyyy][MM][dd][hh][mm][ss][sss])

issuingCompanyCode.description: Receipt issuing company (Validating carrier code in airline context)

issuingStatusCode.description: Receipt issuing status code. In Amadeus context values are: T Ticketing, P Printed (for ETKT only), R Refunded, V Void, I Exchanged

issuingTypeCode.description: Receipt issuing type code. In Amadeus context values are: M for Manual Ticket, A for Automatic Ticket, D for Electronic Miscellaneous Document, TE & E for Electronic ticket, TP & P for Paper ticket, TV & V for Virtual MCO, TL & L for Low-cost Carrier Ticket

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

removed.description: True if should be considered as removed, ie not present anymore in PNR for instance

companyCode.description: Code of the company in charge of receipt issuing. In airline context, it is typically the plating carrier code

conjunctiveReferenceNb.description: Conjunctive reference total number if underlying purchase is divided into more than one booklet (a booklet is limited in legacy systems to 4 coupons, thus for booking with more than 4 coupons the ticket will be divided the additional ticket are called conjunctive ticket, their reference number is just the first one incremented by 1, 2, or 3 (no more than 16 coupons are authorized on the same reference) depending on the amount of conjunctive reference.)

number.description: Reference number. Typically in airline context it refers to the document number (ticket or EMD)

confidential.description: True is the total fare is marked as 'confidential'. In airline context it means the fare should not appear on the ticket being displayed to the customer (i.e. confidential for the customer not the airline)

endorsement.description: Endorsement. In airline context, endorsement as stated in the tarification

forInfant.description: True if this purchase is restricted to an infant

payment.description: Payment restriction. In airline context, payment restriction as stated in the tarification

tourCode.description: Tour code. In airline context, tour code as stated in the tarification

old.description: In case of a re-issuance, if an extra cost is incurred, it will indicate whether that particular tax was paid during the first issuance (prevention of double payment)

termOfUse.description: Coupon global terms of use details

companyCode.description: Code of the company in charge of the connected receipt issuing. In airline context, it is typically the plating carrier code

number.description: Reference number. Typically in airline context it refers to the document number (ticket)

code.description: Code associated with of the service

autoConsumable.description: Indicates if the ancillaries service is consumed at issuance

exchangeable.description: Indicates if the ancillaries service is exchangeable

interlineable.description: Indicates if the ancillaries service is interlineable

presentAt.description: Indicates where the ancillary service is to be provided (e.g. Paris Orly Aiport)

presentTo.description: Indicates who is providing the ancillary service (e.g. Delta Airline)

refundable.description: Indicates if the ancillaries service is refundable

validityEnd.description: When the ancillary validity period is supposed to end (deadline) if present (format=[yyyy][MM][dd][hh][mm][ss][sss])

validityStart.description: When the ancillary validity period is supposed to start if present (format=[yyyy][MM][dd][hh][mm][ss][sss])

commercialBookingClass.description: Commercial booking class. In airline context, it is typically the marketing airline booking class

commercialPhysicalClass.description: Commercial physical class. In airline context, it is typically the marketing airline transportation class (cabin)

operationalBookingClass.description: Operational booking class. In airline context, it is typically the operational airline booking class

operationalPhysicalClass.description: Operational physical class. In airline context, it is typically the operational airline transportation class (cabin)

physicalType.description: Physical type of the transport mode. In airline context, it is typically the aircraft type as designated within IATA (eg: A320)

clean.description: Clean version of the passenger name, not present if the cleaning process failed

cleanIdentifications.description: List of clean traveler's identifications, not present if the cleaning process failed (in airline context typically DOC-S elements, contains passport info for instance)

cleanVisas.description: List of clean traveler's VISAs, not present if the cleaning process failed (in airline context typically DOC-O elements)

titleCode.description: Traveler's title code (eg: MR, DR, etc...)

reference.description: Loyalty program usage (ACCRUAL: miles accrual, AGREEMENT: miles accrual on another carrier, REDEEM : miles usage, UPGRADE: miles usage for upgrade)

tattoo.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

contacts.description: Traveler's contacts (addresses, email, or phones for instance)

identity.description: Traveler's identity details (name, title, gendre, etc...)

infantIdentity.description: Traveler's associated infant identity details (name, title, gendre, etc...)

loyaltyPrograms.description: Traveler's loyalty programs (frequent traveler number, etc...)

type.description: Type of passenger such as ADT, INF, CHD... also known as PTC in airline context

cleanAddress.description: List of cleaned addresses, not present if the cleaning process failed

cleanEmails.description: List of cleaned emails, not present if the cleaning process failed

cleanOthers.description: List of cleaned other contacts, not present if the cleaning process failed

cleanPhones.description: List of cleaned phones, not present if the cleaning process failed

boarded.description: Indicates if the passenger should be considered as boarded

passStatus.description: Boarding pass status printed (PRINTED), not printed (NOT_PRINTED) or reprinted (REPRINT_NEEDED)

report.description: Boarding report, ie what is the reason for not boarding for instance

channel.description: Channel used by a passenger to checkin for a specific transport (in Amadeus context:  A: Airline check-in agent, S: Self service machine, D: Direct consumer, E: Electronic selling system)

status.description: Status of a passenger checkin for a specific transport (accepted, rejected, or queued)

type.description: Channel type used by a passenger to checkin for a specific transport (in Amadeus context CPC: Cryptic, EXD: External departure control system, JFE: Java Front-End, KSK: Kiosk, MBL: Mobile phone, SMS, TEL: Telephone, WEB: Internet)

baggageTags.description: Baggage tags for a passenger that has at least been boarded (might be deboarded afterward)

baggageTotalWeight.description: Baggage total weight for a passenger that has at least been boarded (might be deboarded afterward)

booked.description: Indicates if the passenger was originally booked

compensation.description: Potential compensation data for a passenger that was finally not boarded

regradeStatus.description: Describes if the customer's class has been upgraded or downgraded, with or against his/her will following possible values : REGRADE_REFUSED, REGRADE_INVOLUNTARY, UPGRADE_INVOLUNTARY, DOWNGRADE_INVOLUNTARY, REGRADE_VOLUNTARY, UPGRADE_VOLUNTARY, DOWNGRADE_VOLUNTARY

seat.description: Last seat assigned to a passenger that has at least been boarded (might be deboarded afterward)

connectedReference.description: Reference of the potential linked receipt (in airline context, for EMD it stands for Issuance in Connection With)

feeOwnerCode.description: Code of the company to which the revenue will be affected

serviceType.description: Type of the service, in airline context: Reason for Issuance SubCode (RFISC)

termOfUse.description: Coupon global terms of use details

external.description: True if this purchase is not coming from the company main GDS. Typically identifying a document received through a SSR TKNx in airline context

id.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

transportId.description: Identification of the transport to which the request is associated

transportReference.description: Reference of the transport to which the request is associated

baggageAllowance.description: Details on booking associated baggage allowance

revisions.description: Revisions where item was present (only used for revalidation)

transportId.description: Identification of the transport to which the trip booking is associated

transportReference.description: Reference of the transport to which the trip booking is associated

ratePerUnit.description: Rate per unit (in airline context used for specific EMD - currently bag EMD only)

code.description: Requested service item code. In airline context, values can be anything from IATA standard codes (RQST, VGML, XBAG, ...) to airline specific ones

companyCode.description: Code of the company (airline) to which the request has been sent

coupon.description: Coupon usage associated with the requested service

id.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

removed.description: True if should be considered as removed, ie not present anymore in PNR for instance

revisions.description: Revisions where item was present (only used for revalidation)

transportId.description: Identification of the transport to which the request is associated

transportReference.description: Reference of the transport to which the request is associated

uuid.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

areas.description: Definition of different seat areas. In airline context, values are: A for Aisle seat, B for Bassinet, FC for Front of aircraft, E for Exit row, J for Rear Facing, K for Bulkhead seat, L for Leg Space, T for Tail of aircraft, UP for Upper deck, W for Window seat

commercialDesignator.description: Commercial designation of the transport. In airline context, different from operational one in case of code share transport

id.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

informative.description: True if the transport is said informative. In airline context, transport from another company handled on another PSS and present in the SBR for information only. No update/pricing/ticket issuance/cancelling etc... possible

loyaltyUsages.description: Loyalty programs used on this transport booking

open.description: True if the transport is said OPEN, ie without any scheduling yet

operationalDesignator.description: Operational designation of the transport. In airline context, different from commercial one in case of code share transport

reference.description: PSS internal ID, (tattoo in SBR for instance)

removed.description: True if should be considered as removed, ie not present anymore in PNR for instance

statusCode.description: Status code associated to the transport booking. In airline context, values are HK, KK, UN, KL...

uuid.description: Here for backward compatibility during technical_field -> _technical_field migration

primaryCode.description: Primary code of the fare basis

ticketDesignator.description: Ticket designator of the fare basis
